resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

pitrou commented on pull request #3660: ARROW-4587: [C++] Fix segfaults around DoPut implementation
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3660#discussion_r257702000
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/ipc/writer.h
 ##########
 @@ -298,11 +299,13 @@ namespace internal {
 
 // These internal APIs may change without warning or deprecation
 
-// Intermediate data structure with metadata header plus zero or more buffers
-// for the message body. This data can either be written out directly as an
+// Intermediate data structure with optional FlightDescriptor,
 
 Review comment:
   I find it weird that we add a FlightDescriptor buffer in our Flight-agnostic IPC format. @wesm, what's your take on this?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.

URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/3660#discussion_r257749929
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/src/arrow/ipc/writer.h
 ##########
 @@ -298,11 +299,13 @@ namespace internal {
 
 // These internal APIs may change without warning or deprecation
 
-// Intermediate data structure with metadata header plus zero or more buffers
-// for the message body. This data can either be written out directly as an
+// Intermediate data structure with optional FlightDescriptor,
 
 Review comment:
   Yes, I also find it weird. We should use composition with `IpcPayload` in the Flight implementation instead if possible

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
After Wes fixed the undefined behavior, it turns out the implementation of DoPut on the client side is now wrong. It should construct an IpcPayload instead of going through the underlying Protobuf.

Additionally, a previous patch accidentally exposed arrow::ipc::DictionaryMemo under arrow::DictionaryMemo.
